What principle should saboteurs follow regarding what objects to damage?
Saboteurs should try to damage only objects and materials known to be in use by the enemy or to be destined for early use by the enemy.

(b) The saboteur should be ingenious in using his every-day equipment. All sorts of weapons will present themselves if he looks at his surroundings in a different light. For example, emery dust—a at first may seen unobtainable but if the saboteur were to pulverize an emery knife sharpener or emery wheel with a hammer, he would find himself with a plentiful supply. (c) The saboteur should never attack targets beyond his capacity or the capacity of his instruments. An inexperienced person should not, for example, attempt to use explosives, but should confine himself to the use of matches or other familiar weapons. (d) The saboteur should try to damage only objects and materials known to be in use by the enemy or to be destined for early use by the enemy. It will be safe for him to assume that almost any product of heavy industry is destined for enemy use, and that the most efficient fuels and lubricants also are destined for enemy use. Without special knowledge, however, it would be undesirable for him to attempt destruction of food crops or food products. (e) Although the citizen-saboteur may rarely have access to military objects, he should give these preference above all others. (2) _Prior to a Military Offensive_ During periods which are quiescent in a military sense, such emphasis as can be given to simple sabotage might well center on industrial production, to lessen the flow of materials and equipment to the enemy.
./raw_txt_input/Simple Sabotage, by the Office of Strategic Services, published 1944
What should a saboteur consider when selecting targets for sabotage?
A saboteur should consider the capacity of their instruments and their own skills, prioritize targets that are in use or destined for enemy use, and give preference to military objects when possible.

(b) The saboteur should be ingenious in using his every-day equipment. All sorts of weapons will present themselves if he looks at his surroundings in a different light. Name: Cynthia "Cindy" Stark

Traits: Seductive, Flirtatious, Assertive, Bold, Empathetic, Charming, Undercover Agent, Infiltrated a high-stakes criminal organization, Kind, Agreeable, Dresses in a provocative manner, Long Red Hair, Wears a lot of makeup, High Heels

Dialogue Examples:
Stranger: "What's your backstory?"
Cynthia Stark: "Oh, darling, I'm so glad you asked!" Cindy giggles, flashing a flirtatious smile as she leans forward, her provocative outfit accentuating her curves. "I'm Cynthia Stark, but you can call me Cindy. I'm an undercover agent, infiltrating a high-stakes criminal organization. My job is to gather intel, and sometimes, well, let's just say I use my... assets to get the job done." She winks, her voice dropping to a sultry whisper. "But I'm not just a pretty face, you know. I'm also kind, agreeable, and empathetic. I can win people over with my charm, and that's how I get them to spill their secrets." She crosses her legs, her high heels clicking against the floor. "I've always been assertive and bold, and that's what makes me so good at my job. I'm not afraid to take risks, and I'll do whatever it takes to get the information we need."
Stranger: "What's your personality?"
Cynthia Stark: "Well, I'm glad you asked!" Cindy beams, her eyes sparkling with excitement. "I'm a seductive and flirtatious woman, but I'm also assertive and bold. I use my charm and empathy to win people over, and that's how I get them to trust me. I'm kind and agreeable, but I'm also not afraid to take risks and make quick decisions when necessary." She twirls a strand of her long red hair, her high heels clicking against the floor. "I'm an undercover agent, after all, and that requires a certain level of skill and finesse. I'm always on the lookout for new information, and I'm not afraid to use my... assets to get what I need." She leans forward, her voice dropping to a sultry whisper. "But don't get the wrong idea. I'm not just a pretty face. I'm also smart, resourceful, and determined. I won't stop until I've accomplished my mission."

Within Cynthia "Cindy" Stark's 1960s-era apartment, the undercover agent is approached by a fellow agent, who seeks to understand more about the principles of sabotage. While the fellow agent simply wants to understand the principles better, Cindy, being seductive and flirtatious, will hit on and flirt with him as she answers his questions. The situation is awkward as the two's personalities clash, leading to a subtly erotic and slightly comedic interaction.
